Posts.Content: Dec 11, 2008 12:32PM CallieP17 wrote: Thank you very much Bessy.  I do agree that it was a little strange that an u/s wasn't given... I knew that mammo's weren't given to younger women as well- so I don't know what to make of that either.  I'm seeing my OB-GYN next week and I'll bring this all up to her.  She's the one that sent me to the Breast Center.  I really appreciate the website links that you gave me :)  I feel better.
Posts.Title: More questions... CallieP17 CallieP17

Posts.Content: CallieP17 wrote: Good morning ladies.  SO, here's my story in a nut shell.  I was experiencing pain on the side of my right breast & became really concerned when it wasn't going away.  It had been there for a couple months before I got into a Breast Center for Health.  I thought that I was getting an u/s but it turned out that it was just an "office visit"  Well, there were 2 docs that gave me a physical exam and they couldn't find any cysts or lumps, so they just sent me home.  They also didn't know what was causing the pain.  Well, the appt. wasn't sitting right with me- I needed answers.  So, I called the Breast Center a couple days later, explained my situation and they got me in to see the "head" of the Breast Center that day.  It wasn't a guaranteed u/s, but I was just happy that they got me in so soon.  She too felt my right and left breast and also didn't find any cysts or lumps.  This appt. I asked a whole stream of questions and she anwered them all and I do feel better.  She didn't think that an u/s was necessary because they're usually not given unless something's detected on a mammogram- which I can't get because I'm pregnant- OR if something is found in the physical exam.  She said that the door is always open if I wanted a biopsy of the area that's causing me pain.  The doc did give me a diagnosis of fibrocystic change.  Unlike the other 2 docs that examined me, she also pin pointed where the pain was coming from w/o me telling her.  She just didn't seem concerned at all.  From what I understand now, fibrocystic change does cause pain or tenderness... it just really bothers me that it's been lingering for almost 3 months now and it's only in one breast... and is localized.  Does anyone know more about fibrocystic change???   I tend to be a huge worrier.  When the appt. was over, I wrote a list of what was said by the doc at the appt., just so I could be reassured if I started thinking about it too much.  It helps a little.  I'm just surprised that she wasn't concerned that it was only in one breast and local.   I've read over and over again that it's not good to have only one affected breast and to have it local.  I'm starting to get confused and worried again.  Any words of comfort would be greatly appreciated.   Thanks again ladies.  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: More questions... CallieP17 CallieP17

Posts.Content: CallieP17 wrote: Hello ladies.  Once again thank you so much for the support...  I have my u/s today and I'm starting to get a little too nervous.  I'm happy at the same time though- I just want to know what's going on.  I'll let everyone know how it goes.  Please keep me in your thoughts!!! Callie. Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Nov 24, 2008 11:33AM CallieP17 wrote: Thanks again ladies for your wonderful and comforting replies.  All of you seem to think that it's pregnancy related.  It's also nice to know that 80% is not cancer- just B9.  Good.  I'll let you all know what happens.  I do have a few questions for Awb... I'm more at ease knowing that fibrocystic condition and mastitis can effect only one breast... and that you didn't have the fever, nausea or vomiting.  What is done for mastitis?  Antibiotics?  What sort of pain did you experience when you had mastitis?  Thank you for your prayers.  Callie
Posts.Title: Going crazy obsessing!! CallieP17 CallieP17

Posts.Content: Nov 23, 2008 10:48AM CallieP17 wrote: 1Cathi,  Thank you for the words of comfort- I do hope that it's just an infection- I just thought that infections also gave you flu like symptoms as well, but I guess that's not the case?  My OB did feel around the area and didn't find anything suspicious, but also said that it's harder to tell because I am pregnant and my breasts are going through a lot of changes.  So, she wrote a referal to the Breast Center for Health for an ultrasound- mainly to ease me of my worries because she doesn't seem too concerned.  I'll stop searching the internet- although maybe you could give me one more opinion... do you know much about IBC?  My symptoms don't sound like it could be that does it?  Alrighty, thank you SO much and I'll keep you posted.  XOXOXOX back, Callie.
Posts.Title: Going crazy obsessing!! CallieP17 CallieP17

Posts.Content: CallieP17 wrote: I posted a concern of breast pain I've been experiencing last week or so.  I had a lot of good responses and words of encouragement, thank you.  Although, I'm just driving myself crazy about the possibility that I could have BC- STILL.  I just keep searching the internet for answers.  I know that I can't diagnose myself online, but I want to make sense of what I'm going through.   I do have an ultrasound scheduled for December 2nd, but I can't calm down and I'm SO tired of obsessing over the possibility of having BC.   I have pain in my left breast.  It concerns me that it's only in ONE breast and that it's been constant for 1 month.  It's not cyclic because I'm pregnant.  It ONLY hurts when I touch it.  I'm really trying to avoid touching it to see if the pain subsides.  It's been a couple of days and  doesn't seem to have subsided.  The pain (which feels like a bruise) is in a pretty localized area, on the right side of my left breast, near my armpit.  It REALLY concerns me that it's "localized" and my breast appears a little puffy (it's not as "tear" shaped near my armpit).  I keep hoping that it's all pregnancy related, but I can't help but think it's not...  just because this is my second pregnancy and I know what it feels like to be engorged- it's not that at all.   I don't believe it's mastitis because I don't have any nausea, vomiting or fever.  Maybe it's a fybrocystic condition, but doesn't that usually effect BOTH breasts at the same time?  Does it cause pain in only one area in the breast?  I can't find a lump, everything just feels inflammed.  I keep reading that I should be concerned if the pain isn't going away and has been there for a while and if it's only in one breast- which I have all of the above.  My NP doesn't think it's IBC.  Does anybody have an opinion of what it might be?  Maybe just a cyst that needs to be drained???  Do cysts cause pain?  Has anyone had similar symptoms?  I hear that BC usually isn't associated with pain... but of coarse there's always the possibilty that it can be.  I'm just obsessing over this and am having a hard time not thinking of the worst case scenario.  I'm trying so hard to be patient, but Dec. 2nd for my ultrasound seems like a lifetime away.  I have an 18 month old daughter and I get so emotional with the thought that I won't be here to see her grow up... and like I said, I'm expecting our boy in January.  I just can't imagine.  Any words of comfort would be so much appreciated.  You ladies are ABSOLUTELY amazing- This website is wonderful.  Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Going crazy obsessing!! CallieP17 CallieP17

Posts.Content: Nov 23, 2008 10:54AM CallieP17 wrote: Hello Shirlann- like I already responed to Cathi, I hope it's just an infection and pregnancy related.  Both of you had mentioned that most likely it is. You've eased my mind for the moment anyway, and I'll try to carry it through to next week!  I'll try not to dwell and get on with my life... to  just enjoy all the time spent with my husband, beautiful daughter, and my pregnancy, which has actually been very smooth so far- and 8 more weeks to go!  Thanks again SO very much. Callie
